Name: OpenNeuro
Description: Filtering, >600 datasets, one of best repositories; leans toward fMRI and EEG but also everything

Name: Dandi
Description: One of best repositories; leans toward fine function and structure but also everything else

Name: OpenDatasets
Description: Good meta-repository; includes good description, e.g. giant unification study

Name: MICRONS Explorer
Description: mouse EM dataset

Name: Natural Scenes Dataset
URL to Dataset: Must fill out form for access: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSduTPeZo54uEMKD-ihXmRhx0hBDdLHNsVyeo_kCb8qbyAkXuQ/viewform
Description: (used by MedARC and 2023 Algonauts Challenge)

Name: Brain Image Library
Description: brain CONNECTS dataset in the US

Name: Open Ephys
URL to Dataset: Most repositories listed are repeats, direct data is listed below

Name: Allen Open Datasets
Description: connectome, transcriptome and calcium! calcium here: https://portal.brain-map.org/explore/circuits/visual-coding-2p

Name: NeMO
Description: Omic data

Name: Flywire
Description: drosophila connectome

Name: BossDB
Description: Volumetric database for 3D and 4D neuroscience data, focused on Electron Microscopy and X-ray Micro/Nano Tomography

Name: Neuromorpho
Description: Inventory of digitally reconstructed neurons and glia associated with peer-reviewed publications

Name: 1000 Functional Connectomes Project
Description: Fully open downloadable database of 1200 resting state fMRI datasets collected from 33 sites around the world

Name: ABA Mouse Brain: CellType Ephys Data
Description: Mouse brain cell ephys data in various anatomical regions. Databases of neuronal cell types based on multimodal characterization of single cells to enable data-driven approaches to characterization

Name: BrainMaps
Description: Interactive, multiresolution next-generation brain atlas that is based on over 140 million megapixels of sub-micron resolution, annotated, scanned images of serial sections of both primate and non-primate brains

Name: (CRCNS) Collaborative Research in Computational Neuroscience
Description: Experimental data sets of high quality that will be valuable for testing computational models of the brain and new analysis methods. The data include physiological recordings from sensory and memory systems, as well as eye movement data

Name: EEGbase
Description: Information related to EEG/ERP research, including data, tools and resources.

Name: Information eXtraction from Images (IXI dataset)
Description: Nearly 600 MR images from normal, healthy subjects

Name: ModelDB
Description: ModelDB provides an accessible location for storing and efficiently retrieving computational neuroscience models that can be filtered by cell type, network models, pathophysiologies, etc. Mostly computational models

Name: NeuronDB
Description: Dynamically searchable database of three types of neuronal properties: voltage gated conductances, neurotransmitter receptors, and neurotransmitter substances

Name: COINS
Description: Allows for uploading, sharing, and querying of datasets. Includes more than 1,000 ABIDE datasets (including functional and structural imaging data and phenotypic data for the study of autism) and the CoRR dataset, consisting of 1,629 Subjects 3,357 Anatomical Scans, 5,093 Resting Functional Scans, 1,302 Diffusion Scans, 300 CBF and ASL Scans

Name: NeuroML
Description: Sharing complex, multiscale neuron and neuronal network models; mostly single cell models

Name: NeuroVault
Description: Publicly store and share unthresholded statistical maps, parcellations, and atlases produced by MRI and PET studies. Awful UX unfortunately; many datasets appear to be ~6 fMRI images, unclear if full dataset is stored elsewhere

Name: NITRC
URL to Dataset: links to multiple datasets, notable ones linked below (BIRN, 1000 Functional Connectomes Project, Task-based fMRI atlases, )
Description: Image repository (IR) to support NIfTI and DICOM neuroimaging data that is searchable by metadata, such as handedness and gender. Contains over a dozen datasets, with thousands of subjects and imaging sessions

Name: Open Source Brain
Description: Public repository for detailed neuronal models in standardised formats. Allows for querying. Seems to be all DANDI, I’d remark to low priority

Name: StudyForrest
Description: MRI data repository that holds a set of 7-Tesla MRI images and behavioral metadata. Housed on OpenNeuro

Name: USC Multimodal Connectivity Database
Description: Web-based repository and analysis site for connectivity matrices that have been derived from de-identified neuroimaging data

Name: CCF
Description: Behavioral and 3T MR imaging data from over 500 healthy adult participants

Name: OASIS
URL to Dataset:
OASIS 1: OASIS 1 Link
OASIS 2: OASIS 2 Link
OASIS 3 and 4: Require account
Description: Neuroimaging and processed imaging data across a broad demographic, cognitive, and genetic spectrum. There are four different OASIS datasets that require different methods of access. The primary modality is MRI, but each dataset states that it comes with fMRI as well. Also housed on XNAT

Name: XNAT
Description: Contains 396 projects, 7078 subjects, and 16612 imaging sessions. Mainly involves MR, PET, and CT

Name: Open NeuroData
Description: Click on type of modality at top to see datasets        Multiple neuroimaging datasets (as Neuroglancer Precomputed Volumes) across multiple modalities and scales, ranging from nanoscale (electron microscopy), to microscale (cleared lightsheet microscopy and array tomography), and mesoscale (structural and functional magnetic resonance imaging)

Name: GIN
Description: Open data management system designed for comprehensive and reproducible management of neuroscientific data. Contains a very wide variety of datasets

Name: EBRAINS
Description: Free and open database of neuroscience data, computational models and software tools

Name: IDA
Description: Provides tools and resources for de-identifying, integrating, searching, visualizing and sharing a diverse range of neuroscience data. Contains 151 studies and 97,744 subjects

Name: PhysioNet
Description: Free access to large collections of physiological and clinical data. Contains some neural datasets

Name: ARDC
Description: Provides access to various neuroscience datasets from Australian research institutions. Some require access from the labs

Name: Brain Catalogue
Description: Shares datasets related to comparative brain anatomy across species. Comparison across species

Name: NES
Description: EEG, EMG, TMS, and generic data collection

Name: NDA NIMH
Description: Informatics platform that facilitates data sharing across all mental health and other research communities. Repositories currently supported include the NIMH Data Archive (NDA), the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development Study (ABCD), the Connectome Coordination Facility (CCF), and the NIAAA Data Archive (NIAAA DA) Focuses more on disorders

Name: Radboud Repository
Description: Holds all datsets from Radboud University, can filter to get cognitive neuroscience and neuroscience datasets

Name: Knowledge Space
Description: Thousands of datasets indexed from the world's leading neuroscience data repositories, including OpenNeuro, ModelDB, NeuroMorpho, etc. Can be filtered to look through individual repositories or all at once

Name: Zenodo
Description: General data repository, can search for e.g. “fMRI”

Name: Alzheimer’s Disease Neuroimaging Initiative
Description: MRI and PET images, genetics, cognitive tests, CSF and blood biomarkers as predictors of Alzheimer’s disease

Name: BIRN fMRI and MRI Data
Description: fMRI, MRI scans and atlases for human and mouse brains
